REVISED 06-22-2010
COPANO PIPELINES/UPPER GULF COAST, L.P. STATEMENT OF OPERATING CONDITIONS IN COMPLIANCE WITH 18 CFR ?284.123(e) (EFFECTIVE JANUARY 4, 1993) This Statement of Operating Conditions shall describe how Copano Pipelines/Upper Gulf Coast, L.P.. ("Transporter"), an intrastate pipeline, will engage in transportation arrangements conducted under ?311(a) (2) of the Natural Gas Policy Act of 1978 ("NGPA") for any eligible shipper from and after January 1, 1993. This supercedes any and all previous 18.CFR ?284.123(e) filings. 1. Availability. Subject to available capacity, Transporter is willing to render transportation service on an interruptible basis only, pursuant to written contracts with eligible shippers, provided that: (a) The shipper provides Transporter with a written request for transportation service which contains the information described in Section 2 of this Statement of Operations; (b) Transporter determines that sufficient capacity is available for the requested transportation service; (c) The shipper has agreed to transport a minimum daily quantity of 500 MMBtu of natural gas; (d) All state and federal approvals, if any, have been obtained by Transporter and the shipper for all services and facilities to be provided or used by Transporter and the shipper which are related to the transportation services to be performed by Transporter; (e) Transporter is satisfied, in its sole opinion, that the transportation service will be on behalf of an interstate state pipeline or a local distribution company served by an interstate pipeline; (f) The shipper has and continues to satisfy the requirements of this Statement of Operating Conditions; (g) The shipper meets Transporter's standards for creditworthiness, as determined solely by Transporter; (h) The Shipper reimburses Transporter for all reporting fees assessed by FERC; and (i) An Interruptible 311 Transportation Service Agreement, substantially in the form of Exhibit "A", attached hereto, is executed by Transporter and the shipper for transportation service under ?311(a) (2) of the NGPA, or Transporter agrees to begin such transportation pending execution of the Interruptible 311 Transportation Service Agreement. 2. Requests for Transportation. All requests for transportation service under Section 311(a)(2) of the NGPA shall be made in writing and be directed to Copano Pipelines/Upper Gulf Coast, L.P., 2727 Allen Parkway, Suite 1200, Houston, Texas 77019. Each request shall contain the following information: (a) The maximum daily quantities to be received and delivered by Transporter during the term of the request; (b) The point(s) of receipt into Transporter's pipeline; (c) The point(s) of delivery out of Transporter's pipeline; (d) The commencement and termination dates of the requested service; and (e) The identity of all pipelines, end-users, local distribution companies, or other parties transporting or receiving the gas, including the identity of the interstate pipeline or local distribution company served by an interstate pipeline on whose behalf Transporter will be transporting gas under ?311(a)(2) of the NGPA. A request for transportation service under this Statement of Operating Conditions will not be considered valid if the requested transportation service is scheduled to commence more than two months after the information required above is provided to Transporter or if all the requirements set forth herein are not met within 90 days after Transporter has determined and notified the shipper that sufficient capacity exists to comply with the shipper's request. Furthermore, a transportation contract shall be executed by Shipper and Transporter following Transporter's acceptance of Shipper's request for service. In the event the transportation contract is not executed and returned by Shipper within thirty (30) days after Transporter tenders the contract, the request for service and the offer to transport shall be deemed invalid. 3. Available Capacity and Priority Determination. Upon receipt by Transporter of the shipper's information specified in Section 2 above, Transporter shall determine whether sufficient capacity is available to satisfy the shipper's request. Should sufficient capacity exist for a valid request for transportation service received by Transporter, Transporter shall so notify the shipper. Transportation services under Section 311 of the NGPA will be performed on a first come, first served basis but as adjusted pursuant to the priority schedule contained in the next paragraph hereof. Should sufficient capacity not exist in Transporter's existing facilities to satisfy all services requested, or should there be a need to curtail services by Transporter, capacity in Transporter's system will be allocated pursuant to the following priority schedule: First Priority: Firm and interruptible intrastate sales and transportation services provided by Transporter, whether commenced before or after the commencement of any particular interruptible sales and transportation services being provided by Transporter pursuant to Section 311 of the NGPA. Second Priority: Sales services provided by Transporter pursuant to Section 311 of the NGPA whether commenced before or after the commencement of any particular interruptible transportation service provided by
Transporter pursuant to Section 311 of the NGPA. Third Priority: Interruptible transportation service provided or to be provided by Transporter pursuant to Section 311 of the NGPA as of the date a valid request was received by Transporter from a particular shipper requesting transportation service hereunder; provided, however, that in the event a shipper is not paying the maximum lawful fee which Transporter may charge, the shipper's priority status may be adjusted by the contractual arrangement between the shipper and Transporter. 4. Facilities. Transporter shall not be obligated to add any facilities or expand the capacity of Transporter's pipeline system in any manner to provide transportation service to a shipper hereunder. 5. Other Terms and Conditions and Reservations. The other terms and conditions applicable to the service hereunder are as described in the form Interruptible 311 Transportation Service attached hereto as Exhibit "A". Transporter reserves the right to make non-material changes to such form without having to resubmit the revised form to FERC and without having to amend this Statement of Operating Conditions. Transporter reserves the right to adopt imbalance penalties, cash out provisions, or other provisions necessary to deal with delivery imbalances if Transporter determines that such are necessary, with such provisions to be incorporated in an amendment hereto. Transporter receives the right to amend this Statement of Operating Conditions and Transporter's Interruptible 311 Transportation Services Agreement at any time. Copano Pipelines/Upper Gulf Coast, L.P.

INTERRUPTIBLE 311 TRANSPORTATION SERVICE AGREEMENT COPANO PIPELINES/UPPER GULF COAST, L.P. STATEMENT OF OPERATING CONDITIONS IN COMPLIANCE WITH 18 CFR ?284.123(e) (EFFECTIVE JANUARY 1, 1993) This Agreement is made and entered into this ___ day of ________ 1993, by and between COPANO PIPELINES/UPPER GULF COAST, L.P. hereinafter referred to as "Transporter", and _______________, a _____________corporation hereinafter referred to as "Shipper". WITNESSETH WHEREAS, Transporter is an intrastate pipeline company as defined in the Natural Gas Policy Act of 1978 with facilities to be utilized hereunder located wholly within the State of Texas; and WHEREAS, Shipper desires that Transporter receive, transport, and redeliver certain quantities of gas through Transporter's system on an interruptible basis; and WHEREAS, Transporter has determined, in its sole opinion, that its system has available capacity to transport Shipper's gas and is willing to assist Shipper in the transportation of said gas through its system. NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and of the mutual covenants and agreements herein set forth, the parties do covenant and agree as follows: ARTICLE I MAXIMUM DAILY QUANTITY 1.1 Subject to the terms, limitations, and conditions hereof, Transporter hereby agrees to receive from Shipper at the Receipt Points specified on Exhibit "A", attached hereto and incorporated herein, and transport and deliver Thermally Equivalent Volumes to Shipper at the Delivery Point(s) specified on Exhibit "B", attached hereto and incorporated herein, daily quantities of gas up to the following "Maximum Daily Quantity" of gas: ________________MMBTU per day 1.2 Such transportation shall be on a fully interruptible basis. Transporter, in its sole discretion, may suspend, interrupt, decrease, or cease service hereunder at any time. If Transporter exercises such right, Shipper shall hold Transporter harmless from any loss, claim, damage or expense that such Shipper or any other person may incur by reason of such suspension, interruption, decrease, or cessation. 1.3 Upon request of Shipper and upon Transporter's agreement, Shipper may tender and Transporter may accept for transportation on any day volumes of gas in excess of such Maximum Daily Quantity under the provisions herein. ARTICLE II TRANSPORTATION RATES AND CHARGES 2.1 Subject to the other provisions hereof, Shipper shall pay Transporter for each MMBtu of gas received by Transporter from Shipper at the Receipt Point(s) during the preceding month: a. A "Base Rate" of 28 cents per MMBtu for transportation on Transporter's system, plus b. Any fees for compression, treating, processing, separation, or similar non-transmission services when provided by Transporter for Shipper. c. The Base Rate set forth in (a) will be charged unless Transporter agrees to a lesser rate and confirms same in writing utilizing the form labelled Exhibit "C", attached hereto and incorporated herein. ARTICLE III TERM 3.1 This Agreement shall become effective on __________ 1993 (the "Effective Date"). 3.2 Subject to the other provisions hereof, this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect until _______________1993 and month to month thereafter unless canceled by either party giving thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the other. ARTICLE IV NOTICES 4.1 Unless herein provided to the contrary, any notice request, demand, or statement called for in this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be considered as having been given upon receipt if delivered personally, or by mail or telegraph with all postage and charges prepaid to either Shipper or Transporter at the place designated. Normal operating instructions can be made by telephone. Unless changed, the addresses of the parties are as follows:
TRANSPORTER: SHIPPER: COPANO PIPELINES/UPPER GULF COAST, L.P. 2727 Allen Parkway, Suite 1200 Houston, Texas 77019
Attn: President, Copano Pipelines/Upper Gulf Coast, L.P.
ARTICLE V GOVERNMENTAL REGULATIONS 5.1 This Agreement is subject to all valid rules and regulations of duly constituted governmental authorities having jurisdiction or control over the matters related hereto, including, without limitation, Subpart C of Part 284 of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's Regulations (18 CFR 284.121 et seq.) implementing Section 311(a)(2) of the NGPA, and Copano Pipelines/Upper Gulf Coast, L.P.'s Statement of Operating Conditions ("SOC") filed with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission pursuant thereto, as such SOC may be amended from time to time by Transporter in its sole discretion. 5.2 If, at any time during the term of this Agreement, any federal governmental authority takes any action as to Transporter that results in the imposition upon the transportation services provided for hereunder of terms or conditions that are, in the sole opinion of Transporter, unduly burdensome and unacceptable or that are, with respect to or as a result of, the transportation services provided for under this Agreement, designed to subject or otherwise subjects Transporter, or any of its pipelines or related facilities, to any greater or different regulation or jurisdiction than that existing on the date of initial delivery hereunder (or thereafter as such regulation or jurisdiction may have changed and been accepted by Transporter) then upon written notice to Shipper, Transporter may terminate this Agreement effective one (1) day prior to the effective date of such governmental action. 5.3 Shipper agrees to reimburse Transporter for one hundred percent (100%) of any taxes or increases thereto that may be levied and paid by Transporter directly associated with the transportation or other handling of gas hereunder (other than gross receipts taxes paid to the Railroad Commission of Texas and Federal income taxes). Shipper further agrees to reimburse Transporter for any and all filing fees that Transporter may be required to pay to any regulatory agency with respect to this Agreement or the transportation service performed hereunder includeing fees under 18 CFR 284.126(e). 5.4 The "on behalf of" party or parties are identified on Exhibit "D" attached hereto and incorporated herein. ARTICLE VI GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS 6.1 The General Terms and Conditions attached to this Agreement as Exhibit "E" are hereby incorporated by this reference and made a part of this Agreement. In the event of any conflict between the provisions in the body of this Agreement and the General Terms and Conditions, the terms and provisions in the body of this Agreement shall control. These Agreements shall likewise be subject to and governed by the SOC of Transporter which is in effect from time to time. Transporter's SOC is on file at Transporter's address set forth in Article IV "Notices" above. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be executed in duplicate originals effective as of the date set forth in Article III.
TRANSPORTER: SHIPPER: COPANO PIPELINES/UPPER GULF COAST, L.P.

1 Transporter reserves the right to amend, modify, or change this Exhibit or to substitute a different procedure to reasonably memorialize the parties' agreement. 2 This rate only replaces the Base Rate (as contained in Paragraph 2.1(a) of the Agreement for the specified gas for the specified period. All other fees, charges, or reimbursements shall continue to be due and owing.
EXHIBIT D This Exhibit D is for all purposes attached to and made a part of that certain Interruptible 311 Transportation Service Agreement dated ________________________, by and between Copano Pipelines/Upper Gulf Coast, L.P. and ________________________.
IDENTITY OF "ON BEHALF OF" PARTY Interstate Pipeline
Local Distribution Company Served by an Interstate Pipeline
Shipper hereby certifies that this transaction is "on behalf of" the entity indentified above. Shipper shall cause such entity to provide Transporter with a sworn statement to such effect within 30 days of the Effective Date of the Agreement.
EXHIBIT E These General Terms and Conditions are attached to and made a part of that certain Interruptible 311 Transportation Service Agreement (Agreement) dated ______________ by and between COPANO PIPELINES/UPPER GULF COAST, L.P. (Transporter) and _______________________ (Shipper).
GENERAL TERMS & CONDITIONS CONTENTS
ARTICLE PAGE
GTC I DEFINITIONS E-2
GTC II QUALITY E-4
GTC III MEASUREMENT E-5
GTC IV CHARACTER OF SERVICE E-8
GTC V BILLING & PAYMENT E-9
GTC VI NOMINATIONS, BALANCING AND E-10 FUEL, COST, AND UNACCOUNTED FOR GAS
GTC VII FORCE MAJEURE E-11
GTC VIII LIABILITY E-12
GTC IX WARRANTY AND ASSIGNMENT E-13
GTC X DELIVERY PRESSURER E-14
GTC IX MISCELLANEOUS E-14
ARTICLE GTC-I DEFINITIONS In addition to the terms enclosed in quotation marks which are defined by the immediately preceding word or phrase, the following terms when used in the Agreement, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise, shall have the meaning indicated below: 1.1 The term "gas" shall mean natural gas which meets the respective quality standards for delivery and redelivery contained in this Agreement and which is owned or controlled by Shipper and tendered to Transporter at the Receipt Point(s) or redelivered by Transporter at the Delivery Point(s). 1.2 The term "day" shall mean a period of twenty-four (24) consecutive hours, beginning and ending at 7:00 a.m. central standard time. 1.3 The term "month" shall mean the period beginning at 7:00 a.m. central standard time on the first day of a calendar month and ending at 7:00 a.m. central standard time on the first day of the next succeeding month. The period from the effective date of that Agreement until 7:00 a.m. central standard time on the first day of next succeeding calendar month shall be deemed to be a month, and the period from 7:00 a.m. central standard time on the first day of the last calendar month during the term of this Agreement until 7:00 a.m. central standard time on the day next succeeding the day when this Agreement terminates shall be deemed to be a month. 1.4 The term "Btu" shall mean the quantity of heat required to raise the temperature of one pound avoirdupois pure water from fifty-eight and one half (58.5) degrees to fifty-nine and one half (59.5) degrees Fahrenheit, as defined in the American Gas Association (AGA) Gas Measurement Manual and any subsequent revisions. 1.5 The term "MMBtu" shall mean one million British thermal units. 1.6 The term "Mcf" shall mean one thousand cubic feet of gas. 1.7 The term "cubic foot of gas" for purposes of measurement hereunder shall mean the volume of gas which would occupy one (1) cubic foot of space when such gas is at a temperature of sixty (60) degrees Fahrenheit and at a pressure of fourteen and sixty-five hundredths pounds per square inch absolute (14.65). 1.8 The term "psia" shall mean pounds per square inch absolute. 1.9 The term "Agreement" refers to the Interruptible 311 Transportation Service Agreement, these General Terms and Conditions, and all Exhibits. 1.10 The term "gross heating value" shall mean the number of Btu's liberated by the complete combustion at constant pressure of one (1) cubic foot of gas, at a base temperature of sixty (60) degrees Fahrenheit and a referenced pressure base as set forth herein, with air of the same temperature and pressure of gas, after products of combustion are cooled to the initial temperature of the gas, and after the water of the combustion is condensed to the liquid state. The gross heating value of the gas shall be corrected for the water vapor content of the gas being delivered; provided, however, that if the water vapor content of the gas is seven (7) pounds or less per one million (1,000,000) cubic feet, the gas shall be assumed to be dry and no correction will be made. 1.11 The term "Thermally Equivalent Volumes" shall mean volumes of natural gas that are equal to the MMBtu's received by Transporter from Shipper at the Receipt Point(s) less Shipper's prorata share of fuel, lost, and unaccounted for gas. 1.22 The term "Receipt Point(s)" shall mean the point(s) at which Transporter receives gas from Shipper as set forth on Exhibit "A" of the Agreement. 1.13 The term "Delivery Point(s)" shall mean the point(s) at which Transporter delivers gas to Shipper as set forth on Exhibit "B" of the Agreement. 1.14 The term "Shipper's prorata share of fuel, lost, and accounted for gas" shall mean the product of (a) a fraction the numerator of which is the total volume of gas, in MMBtu's, tendered by Shipper at the Receipt Point(s) during the respective period and the denominator of which is the total volume of gas, in MMBtu's, placed into Transporter's system from all sources during the respective period, multiplied by (b) the remainder of (i) the total volume of gas, in MMBtu's, placed into Transporter's system from all sources during the respective period, minus (ii) the total volume of gas, in MMBtu's, delivered from Transporter's system during the respective period.
ARTICLE GTC-II QUALITY 2.1 All gas received and delivered at the Receipt Point(s) and Delivery Point(s) hereunder shall be merchantable natural gas and shall conform to the following specifications: (a) Liquids: The gas shall be free from hydrocarbons and water in their liquid states at the temperature and pressure delivered. All oil and liquid hydrocarbons separated from the gas by either Shipper or Shipper's producer/supplier prior to delivery to Transporter shall remain the property of Shipper. At all times, any and all liquid or liquefiable hydrocarbons, or any other constituent or by-product, recovered from the gas by Transporter, after delivery of gas to Transporter, shall be and remain the exclusive property of Transporter. (b) Hydrogen Sulphide: The gas shall not contain more than one quarter (1/4) grain of hydrogen sulphide per one hundred (100) cubic feet as determined by a method generally acceptable for use in the gas industry. (c) Total Sulphur: The gas shall not contain more than twenty (20) grains of total sulphur per one hundred (100) cubic feet of gas as determined by a method generally acceptable for use in the gas industry. (d) Temperature: The gas shall not have a temperature of less than forty (40) degrees nor more than one hundred twenty (120) degrees Fahrenheit. (e) Carbon Dioxide and Nitrogen: The gas shall contain not more than two percent (2%) by volume of either carbon dioxide or nitrogen individually and shall contain not more than three percent (3%) by volume of combined nonhydrocarbon gases including, but not limited to, carbon dioxide and nitrogen. (f) Dust, Gums, etc.: The gas shall be commercially free of dust, gums, dirt, impurities and other solid matter. (g) Heating Value: The total gross heating value of the gas deliverable hereunder shall not be less than one thousand (1,000) Btu's per cubic foot.
(h) Oxygen: The gas shall not contain in excess of one tenth of one percent (.1%) by volume of oxygen, and the parties agree to exercise every reasonable effort to keep the gas completely free of oxygen. (i) Water Vapor: The gas shall not contain more than seven (7) pounds of water in vapor phase per one million cubic feet. 2.2 Transporter shall not be obligated to accept gas hereunder which does not conform to these specifications. In the event gas received hereunder does not conform to these quality specifications, Transporter shall notify Shipper of such nonconformance and Shipper shall immediately cease delivery of gas to Transporter or bring such gas within specification. Transporter, at its sole option, may elect from time to time to receive such gas not conforming to the quality specifications herein and thereafter refuse to receive such non-conforming gas. Further, Transporter shall not be obligated to receive and transport any gas which does not meet the quality specifications of the party to whom the gas is to be delivered should those specifications be different than the quality specifications herein. ARTICLE GTC-III MEASUREMENT OF GAS
3.1 The unit of volume for measurement of gas hereunder shall be one (1) cubic foot of gas. Such measured volumes, converted to Mcf, shall be multiplied by their gross heating value per cubic foot and divided by 1,000 to determine MMBtu's received and delivered hereunder. The unit of measurement for the purpose of balancing total receipts and deliveries of gas hereunder and for billing purposes hereunder shall be one (1) MMBtu. 3.2 The average atmospheric (barometric) pressure shall be assumed to be 14.7 psia, irrespective of actual elevation or location of the measurement points above sea level or variations in actual barometric pressure from time to time. 3.3 The temperature of the gas flowing through the measurement facilities hereunder shall be determined by a recording thermometer of standard manufacture continuously used and properly installed so as to accurately record the temperature of the gas being measured. 3.4 The specific gravity of the gas shall be determined by Transporter utilizing the most feasible of the following methods: (a) By means of an on-line chromatograph; (b) By means of a properly installed recording gravitometer of standard manufacture acceptable to Transporter; or (c) By other mutually acceptable methods. 3.5 At least monthly, adjustments to measured gas volumes for the effects of supercompressibility shall be made in accordance with accepted AGA standards. Transporter or its designee shall obtain representative carbon dioxide and nitrogen mole fraction values for the gas delivered or received as may be required to compute such adjustments in accordance with standard testing procedures. At Transporter's option, equations for the calculation of supercompressibility may be taken from either the AGA Manual for the Determination of Supercompressibility Factors for Natural Gas, dated December, 1962, latest revision (also known as the "NX-19 Manual") or AGA Report No. 8, dated December, 1985, Compressibility and Supercompressibility for Natural Gas and Other Hydrocarbon Gases, latest revision. 3.6 The gas shall be measured by orifice meters or other measuring devices operated by Transporter or its designee, which shall be installed and operated in accordance with and as prescribed in Gas Measurement Committee Report No. 3 (Revised 1975) of the AGA, as it is now and from time to time may be revised, amended, supplemented, or succeeded. At Transporter's election, electronic gas measurement may be used. 3.7 The gross heating value of the gas delivered hereunder shall be determined at Transporter's option by using a standard type calorimeter or by calculating the gross heating value from an on-line chromatograph or a gas analysis of a spot or continuous gas sample. The spot or continuous sample shall be taken at least monthly and such sample shall be taken at a suitable point on the facilities to be representative of the gas being metered. 3.8 The party owning, operating, and maintaining the measurement equipment shall be responsible for all of the facilities necessary to accomplish the testing, sampling, and measuring of gas delivered under this Agreement at the Receipt and Delivery Point(s). At those point(s) where both parties have installed measurement equipment, Transporter's or its designee's facilities shall be considered the official measurement for all purposes hereunder. 3.9 The parties hereto shall at all reasonable times have access to the premises of each other insofar as such premises are associated with the measurement of gas, sampling of gas, or the inspection, operation, installation, removal, repair, and testing of equipment, but the operation of measuring equipment and changing of charts shall be done only by the employees or agents of the party that owns the equipment. 3.10 Transporter or its designee shall keep its measuring equipment, including but not limited to meters, chromatographs, calorimeters, sample, gravitometers, and other necessary equipment accurate and in repair. All equipment shall be tested at least quarterly and at other times upon request and at the expense of Shipper. Transporter or its designee agrees to give Shipper sufficient advance notice of the time of such tests of the measuring equipment so that Shipper may have its representative present. 3.11 If, upon any test, any measuring equipment is found to be in error by not more than two percent (2%), previous records of such equipment shall be considered accurate in computing deliveries hereunder. All equipment, in any case, shall be adjusted at the time of tests to record correctly. If the resultant aggregate error in computed delivereies exceeds two percent (2%) at a recording corresponding to the average hourly rate of gas flow for the period since the last preceding test, the previous recordings of such equipment shall be corrected to zero error for any period which is known definitely or agreed upon, but in case the period is not known definitely or agreed upon, such correction shall be for a period extending over one half the time elapsed since the last test date, not to exceed sixteen (16) days when equipment is tested on a monthly basis, and not to exceed forty-five (45) days when equipment is tested on a quarterly basis. In the event any measuring equipment is out of service, or is found to be registering inaccurately and the error is not determinable by test or by previous recordings, deliveries through such equipment shall be estimated: (a) By using the registration of any check meter, if installed and accurately registering, or in the absence of (a); (b) By correcting the error if the percentage of error is ascertainable by calibration, special test, or mathematical calculation, or in the absence of both (a) and (b), then;
(c) By estimating the quantity delivered based on deliveries during preceding periods under similar conditions when the measuring equipment was registering accurately. 3.12 The charts and records from the measuring equipment shall remain the property of the owner thereof and same shall be kept on file for a period of not less than two (2) years or such shorter time determined by a third party, if any, who owns the measuring equipment. At any reasonable time within such period, upon request of the Shipper, Transporter will submit records and charts from its measuring equipment, together with calculations therefrom, for inspection and verification by the Shipper. Such records and charts shall be returned to the Transporter within thirty (30) days after receipt by the Shipper. 3.13 Shipper may, at its option and subject to it obtaining from third parties, install check meters to check the measuring equipment at the Receipt and Delivery Point(s); however, such meters shall be so installed as not to interfere with the operation of Transpoter's or its designee's measuring facilities at the Receipt and Delivery Point(s). Such check meters shall be operated in the same manner as Transporter's or its designee's meters and all related charts and records shall be maintained in the same manner as Transporter's or its designee's charts and records. 3.14 If Transporter does not own the measuring equipment at any Receipt or Delivery Point, it may designate someone to measure the gas at such point and the parties agree to rely on the measurement performed by such designated party, as adjusted in accordance with the specifications and requirements in this Article GTL-III. If Transporter designates Shipper as the measuring party, then Transporter shall have all inspection and verification rights otherwise granted to Shipper under this Article GTC-III. ARTICLE GTC-IV CHARACTER OF SERVICE 4.1 Interruptible transportation services of Transporter hereunder shall be subject to the curtailment and priority provisions contained in Transporter's SOC (as defined in the Agreement) as amended from time to time. Service hereunder on all or any portion of Transporter's facilities may be curtailed pursuant to such provisions due to capacity constraints on all or any portion of Transporter's facilities. 4.3 If for any reason, other than Transporter's lack of capacity, Shipper fails during any consecutive three (3) month period to utilize an average daily flow equal to fifty (50) percent of its Maximum Daily Quantity, then Transporter in its sole discretion and at its sole option may unilaterally reduce Shipper's Maximum Daily Quantity to one hundred twenty-five (125) percent of the average daily flow for the such three (3) month period. ARTICLE GTC-V BILLING AND PAYMENT 5.1 On or before the tenth (10th) day of the month, Transporter shall render an invoice for the quantity of gas received for transportation during the preceding month and the amount due. Shipper shall pay Transporter for the amount due by wire transfer with immediately available funds to Transporter's account in accordance with the instructions contained in Transporter's invoice. Payment shall be due on or before the twentieth (20th) day of the month following the month in which gas was received or ten (10) days from the date of such invoice, whichever is later. 5.2 Should Shipper fail to pay any amount when due, interest thereon shall accrue at the rate of two percent (2%) above the prime commercial rate charged by Citibank, N.A., New York, New York, or at the maximum contract rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is less, compounded annually from the date when due until the amount due and interest have been paid in full. Transporter's entitlement to interest shall be in addition to any other rights and remedies it may have for Shipper's failure to pay, including rights hereby granted to terminate this Agreement upon giving notice to Shipper and/or to suspend the receipt and/or the redelivery of gas hereunder. 5.3 In the event an error is discovered in any statement, payment, charge, or computation, such error shall be adjusted within thirty (30) days of the determination thereof, provided that any statement, payment, charge, or computation shall be final as to both Parties unless objected to in writing within two (2) years after payment has been made. Should a dispute arise over the amount invoiced, Shipper shall pay any undisputed amount due within the specified due date. Shipper shall notify Transporter of any disputed amounts by the due date, and both parties will mutually resolve the dispute in a timely manner. Any disputed amount determined to be a valid amount due will be subject to the interest payment provisions above. 5.4 Upon reasonable written notice, each party shall have the right at reasonable times to examine the books, records, and charts owned or controlled by the other party to the extent necessary to verify the accuracy of any statement, payment, charge, or computation made pursuant to this Agreement. 5.5 Transporter shall extend credit contingent upon the furnishing of evidence of continued financial responsibility, the posting of security, and the execution of security agreements and other documents, as Transporter may reasonably request. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if at any time the financial responsibility of Shipper becomes impaired or unsatisfactory to Transporter, in Transporter's sole opinion, additional security may be requested by Transporter who may discontinue service until such security is received and, if such security is not provided within (10) days after written notice by Transporter to Shipper, Transporter may terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to Shipper. ARTICLE GTC-VI NOMINATIONS, BALANCING, AND FUEL, LOST, AND UNACCOUNTED FOR GAS 6.1 On or before 5:00 p.m. on the fifth working day before the end of each month, Shipper shall provide to Transporter in writing, for the following month, the daily nominations of the quantity of gas (in MMBtu's) to be delivered by Shipper to Transporter at each Receipt Point and the quantity of the gas to be delivered by Transporter to Shipper or for Shipper's account at each Delivery Point. Such nominations shall include all information deemed necessary, in Transporter's sole judgment, to adequately and correctly confirm, allocate, and account for quantities so nominated. Transporter shall maintain a record of such daily nominations. If Shipper fails to provide Transporter with a written nomination on or before 5:00 p.m. on the fifth working day before the end of each month, Shipper shall be deemed to have nominated no quantity at any Receipt or Delivery Point for the following month; provided, however, that Transporter may, but shall not be obligated or required to, accept nominations from Shipper after 5:00 p.m. on the fifth working day before the end of any month. Transporter may, but is not required or obligated to, accept (a) any nomination which exceeds Shipper's maximum daily quantity at any Receipt or Delivery Point or the Maximum Daily Quantity, or (b) any revision to a prior nomination which results in an increase in the quantity to be received or delivered by Transporter. For any change in the daily quantities of gas Shipper desires to receive or deliver at Receipt or Delivery Point(s) which is effective after the start of a month, Shipper shall notify Transporter's gas dispatching department, at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance; however, for any quantities scheduled after 10:00 a.m. on Friday or the day preceding a holiday, such nomination will commence on the following Monday or next business day. Transporter's dispatcher shall thereupon advise Shipper of the quantity it will accept for transportation, which quantity shall be the scheduled quantity unless operating conditions require adjustment thereof. 6.2 Balancing of Thermally Equivalent Volumes of gas received and delivered shall be achieved as nearly as feasible on a daily basis, with any cumulative imbalance accounted for on a monthly basis. Imbalances shall be corrected as soon as possibled but no later than the following month. Imbalances existing at end of the term will be adjusted within thirty (30) days after the end of the term. Transporter reserves the right to impose and enforce any imbalance penalties and cash out provisions, or other obligations with respect to imbalances as may be contained Transporter's SOC in effect from time to time. 6.3 Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, Shipper shall provide to Transporter, at no cost to Transporter a volume of gas equal to Shipper's prorata share of fuel, lost, and unaccounted for gas (as defined in Paragraph 1.14 of Article GTC-I each month. At Transporter's option, Transporter may deduct such volume of gas from the quantity of gas which Transporter is to redeliver at the Delivery Point(s). All balancing requirements herein will take such volume of gas into account. 6.4 Transporter shall not be responsible for eliminating any imbalances in volumes between Shipper and any third-party. ARTICLE GTC-VII FORCE MAJEURE 7.1 If either party is rendered unable, wholly or in part, by force majeure or any other cause of any kind not reasonably within its control, other than financial, to perform or comply with any obligation or condition of this Agreement, upon giving written notice and reasonably full particulars to the other party as soon as reasonably possible, such obligation or condition shall be suspended during the continuance of the inability so caused and such party shall be relieved of failure to perform the same during such period, provided obligations to make payment then due for gas transported hereunder shall not be suspended and the cause for suspension (other than labor disputes, strikes, or lockouts) shall be remedied so far as possible with reasonable dispatch. Settlement of strikes, lockouts, and labor disputes shall be wholly within the discretion of the party having the difficulty. 7.2 The term "force majeure", as used herein, shall mean acts of God, strikes, lockouts, or other industrial disturbances, acts of the enemy, wars, blockades, insurrections, riots, epidemics, landslides, lightning, earthquakes, fires, storms, floods, washouts, hurricanes, tornadoes, arrests and restraints by the government, whether federal or state, civil or military, other government actions (including curtailments and allocations of gas supplies and deliveries), civil disturbances, breakage of lines of pipe, the necessity for maintaining repairs or alterations to machinery equipment or lines of pipe, freezing of wells or line pipes, inability of either party to obtain necessary materials, and any other cause, whether of the kind herein enumerated or otherwise, which is not reasonably within the control of the party claiming suspension. Force majeure shall likewise include (a) in those instances where either party hereto is required to obtain servitudes, easements, permits, or licenses to enable such party to fulfill its obligations hereunder, the inability of such party to acquire, or the delays on the part of such party in acquiring, at reasonable costs and after the exercise of reasonable diligence, such servitudes, easements, permits, or licenses; and (b) in those instances where either party hereto is required to furnish materials and supplies to enable such party to fulfill its obligations hereunder the inability of such party to supply or the delays on the part of such party in supplying at reasonable costs and after the exercise of reasonable diligence such materials and supplies. "Force majeure" shall not include the failure of Shipper to cause gas to be delivered to Transporter inconformance with Shipper's nomination at any Receipt Point. ARTICLE GTC-VIII LIABILITY 8.1 Each Party assumes the responsibility and liability arising from the operation of the facilities owned by it, and agrees to hold the other Party harmless from any liability of whatever nature arising from the owning Party's installation, ownership, or operation thereof. 8.2 As between Transporter and Shipper, Transporter will be deemed to be in control and possession of the gas after its delivery to Transporter at the Receipt Point(s) and prior to its redelivery to Shipper or its designee at the Delivery Point(s) and Shipper will be deemed to be in control and possession of the gas prior to its delivery to Transporter at the Receipt Point(s) and after its redelivery to Shipper to its designee at the Delivery Point(s). The party in control and possession of the gas will be responsible for and shall indemnify the other party against any and all losses, injuries, claims, liabilities, damages, and costs (including attorneys' fees) with respect to any damages to property (including the gas itself) or death or injury to persons caused by the gas and occurring while the gas is deemed to be in the respective party's control and possession; provided, however, that Transporter shall not be responsible to Shipper or any other party for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages or losses resulting from Transporter's performance or nonperformance of the terms of this Agreement. ARTICLE GTC-IX WARRANTY AND ASSIGNMENT 9.1 Shipper warrants for itself, its successors and assigns, that the gas it delivers hereunder shall be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, and claims whatsoever, and that it will have at the time of delivery of gas at the Receipt Points for transportation hereunder good title to and/or the full right and authority to deliver such gas to Transporter for transportation hereunder. Transporter warrants for itself, its successors and assigns, that it will at the time of delivery of the gas transported hereunder have the full right and authority to redeliver such gas to Shipper or for the account of Shipper. 9.2 It is further understood and agreed that the gas redelivered at the Point(s) of Delivery may not be the identical gas that was delivered to Transporter for transportation hereunder, but such gas will be a part of the commingled stream of gas and, for the purpose of this Agreement, the commingled gas may be substituted for Shipper's gas on a heat-equivalent basis. 9.3 The Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns. Transporter may assign this Agreement and its rights and obligations hereunder without the consent of Shipper. No assignment or transfer by Shipper shall be made without written approval from Transporter. Such approval shall not be unreasonably withheld. As between the Parties hereto, such assignment shall become effective on the first day of the month following the receipt by the other party of written notice that such assignment has been effectuated and the receipt by Shipper of written consent from Transporter if applicable. ARTICLE GTC-X DELIVERY PRESSURES 10.1 Gas delivered by Shipper for transportation at the Receipt Point(s) shall be delivered at a pressure sufficient to enter Transporter's pipeline facilities at such point(s), but in no event in excess of Transporter's maximum allowable operating pressure at such point(s). Gas redelivered by Transporter at the Delivery Point(s) shall be delivered at pressures existing in Transporter's pipeline from time to time. Transporter shall not be required to change its operating conditions or install facilities, including compression, to enable the receipt or delivery of Shippers' gas. ARTICLE GTC-IX MISCELLANEOUS 11.1 No waiver by either Party of any one or more defaults in the performance of any provision of the Agreement shall operate or be constructed as a waiver of any existing or future default, whether or a like or a different character. 11.2 The Agreement, with exhibits and material incorporated therein by reference, contains the entire agreement of the Parties with respect to the matters covered by this contract. No other agreement, promise, or statement not contained therein shall be binding or valid. 11.3 As to all matters of construction and interpretation, the Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and governed by the laws of the State of Texas.
